intro: Seselinia serbica, commonly known as Serbian sesel, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. It has a short stature, usually reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters, and produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Seselinia serbica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is also used in traditional herbal medicine.
